reviews.content: Amazing doctor and his staff is wonderful. Him and his wife are super nice and even get you in same day if your sick. Some of the negative comments are not true but i guess people want to give bad reviews because they are internet trolls and have nothing else better to do. By the way I see a user who is complaining about  getting a drug test every month.FYI if you are not aware of the new laws that primary care doctors cant prescribe certain medication and they have to drug test to Protect their license.

Do not go to this doctor if you are looking to be treated for common family practice medical concerns like ADHD.  I've never dealt with a doctor as difficult as Dr. Charles and I've lived in 8 different states and seen multiple providers. Even with 16 years of documented medical history I was interrogated by the doctor to prove my condition. The next appointment with the doctor was not bad, however when I needed to come back the following month for a Rx refill When I ran out of medication they canceled my apt (the day of) and said I couldn't be seen as more than 30 days had past, I've never had that problem before EVER. . This practice is very good with availability, you can schedule the day of and practically be seen, however if you decide to reschedule the day of (and you made your apt that day) they charge you the most ridiculous amount of "no show fee" of $50, and beware they will also cancel on you as well. I had a 7:30 apt I scheduled 2 days prior and they called me the day of at 6:53 am saying not to come in because it had been more than 30 days since I had my last Rx refilled, I get there in the morning at my appointment time to talk to the doctor about it and he hadn't even shown up to the practice yet. . Expect drug tests every visit - I had no problem doing this, however I know not every provider will require you to do so, especially if you come every month for a Rx refill.
